languageKey.label: SAV JpGraph
SAV JpGraph

< data [attributes] > ... < /data > Creates a data object. Attribute: . id="myData". Optional attribute but it is requested when using reference to this object. The reference will be "myData". - < setData attribute /> Defines the data. Attribute: . value="5,6,7". Use a comma-separated list of values. - < setDataFromQuery attribute1 attribute2 /> Defines the data from a query. Attributes: . ref="query#1". An array is expected, in general it is the reference to a query. . field="date". Field which will be used as the index of the array to get the data. - < SetDataFromArray attribute1 attribute2 /> Defines the data from an array. Attributes: . ref="data#result". An array is expected, in general it is the reference to a another data set. . index="2". Index which will be used to get the data. - < setArray attribute1 attribute2 /> Defines an array of data. Attributes: . value="5,6,7". Use a comma-separated list of values. . index="2". Optional index which will be used to set the data otherwise data are inserted in the array starting with the index equal to 0. - < setArrayFromQuery attribute1 /> Defines an array of data from a query. Attribute: . ref="query#1". An array is expected, in general it is the reference to a query. < file [attributes] > ... < /file > Creates a file object. Attributes: . id="myFile". Optional attribute but it is requested when using reference to this object. The reference will be "myFile". Note: id="1" defines the file used by default for saving the resulting image in the "typo3temp/sav_jpgraph" folder. The file name is "img_xxx" where "xxx" is the id of the content object. - < setFile attribute /> Defines the fileName. Attribute: . value="fileadmin/test.png". - < setFileDir attribute /> Defines the root directory. Attribute: . dir="PATH_site". Sets the root directory. Any defined php constant, in particular all TYPO3 path constants, will be interpreted. < foreach [attributes] ref="myData" > ... < /foreach > The tag < foreach > is not related with a class. It is a special tag which was introduced to process arrays. It makes it possible to repeat the sequence inside the tag. The number of repetitions is the size of the reference attribute. < marker [attributes] > ... < /marker > Creates a marker object. Attribute: . id="myMarker". Optional attribute but it is requested when using reference to this object. The reference will be "myMarker". - < setMarker attribute /> Defines the marker. Attribute: . value="Number of pages created per year". < query [attributes]> ... < /query > Creates a query object. Attributes: . id="myQuery". Optional attribute but it is requested when using reference to this object. The reference will be "myQuery". - < select >... < /select > Defines the SELECT clause. See the tutorial for an example. - < from > ... < /from > Defines the FROM clause. See the tutorial for an example. - < where > ... < /where > Defines the WHERE clause. See the tutorial for an example. - < groupby > ... < /groupby > Defines the GROUP BY clause. See the tutorial for an example. - < orderby > ... < /orderby > Defines the ORDER BY clause. - < limit > ... < /limit > Defines the LIMIT clause. < template [attributes] > ... < /template > Creates a template object. Attributes: . id="myTemplate". Optional attribute but it is requested when using reference to this object. The reference will be "myTemplate". - < setTemplateDir attribute /> Defines the root directory for the template. Attribute: . dir="PATH_site". Sets the root directory. Any defined php constant, in particular all TYPO3 path constants, will be interpreted. - < loadTemplate attribute /> Loads the template file name. Attribute: . file="typo3conf/ext/sav_jpgraph/templates/polarex0.xml". - < setCopyImageDir attribute /> Defines the root directory for the copy of the image. Attribute: . dir="PATH_site". Sets the root directory. Any defined php constant, in particular all TYPO3 path constants, will be interpreted. - < copyImageInFile attribute /> Copies the resulting image in a given file. Attributes: . ref="file#1". Sets the root directory. A string is expected, in general it is the reference to a file. . file="fileadmin/test.png". Destination file.
